title: Drawing, Ceiling Design, Alexander and the Family of Darius, the Clemency of Alexander, Sala di Alessandro, Palazzo Naldi, Faenza, 1803
title_raw: Ceiling Design, Alexander and the Family of Darius, the Clemency of Alexander, Sala di Alessandro, Palazzo Naldi, Faenza
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk with unruled border in pen and brown on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower margin: Alessandro alla tenda di Dario
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Alexander, accompanied by officer, enters tent of great king filled with women (and possibly children) imploring his mercy.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Ceiling Design, Alexander and the Family of Darius, the Clemency of Alexander, Sala di Alessandro, Palazzo Naldi, Faenza, 1803. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk with unruled border in pen and brown on white laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3371
